danaus

Class AbstractButterfly

  • java.lang.Object
    • danaus.Entity
      • danaus.AbstractButterfly
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Entity>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Butterfly

    public abstract class AbstractButterfly
extends Entity
    Class AbstractButterfly contains the infrastructure needed to implement a subclass Butterfly but leaves method run() abstract. Thus, a subclass of AbstractButterfly must implement method run() to execute a simulation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractButterfly()
      Constructor: an abstract butterfly with name "butterfly", location null, and image file name "butterfly.png".

      • AbstractButterfly

        public AbstractButterfly()

        DO NOT FORGET to initialize both the butterfly's position and its map.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • learn

        public abstract TileState[][] learn()
        Returns a two-dimensional array of TileStates that represents the map the butterfly is on. During the learning phase of a simulation, butterflies are tasked with learning the map in preparation for the running phase of a simulation. A butterfly should traverse the entire map and generate a two-dimensional array of TileStates in which each TileState corresponds to the appropriate in the map. For example, consider the map with the following TileStates. ----- |a|b|c| ----- |d|e|f| ----- A butterfly should return an identical array. The following arrays are all incorrect. ----- |f|e| | ----- |a|b|d| ----- --- |a|b| --- |d|e| --- The returned array is graded based on the percentage of correctly identified TileStates. It is recommended that a butterfly save the TileState array to use during the running phase of a simulation. For more information, refer to Danaus' documentation.
        Returns:
        A two-dimensional array of TileStates that represents the map the butterfly is on.

      • run

        public abstract void run(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> flowerIds)
        Simulates the butterfly's flight.
        During the transition from the learning phase to the running phase, new flowers are planted on the map. Everything else remains the same. A butterfly must navigate to and collect all the flowers in flowerIds in any order to successfully complete a simulation. You must also not collect extraneous flowers. That is, only collect the flowers represented by flowerIds.
        Parameters:
        flowers - A vector of flowers which the butterfly has to collect
        See Also:
        collect(Flower)

      • flowerList

        public abstract java.util.List<Flower> flowerList()
        Return a list of all the flowers seen by this butterfly. More formally, return the union of the sets of flowers of all visited tiles. If no flowers have been found, the empty list should be returned.
        Returns:
        A list of the discovered flowers, or empty if no flowers have been discovered.

      • flowerLocation

        public abstract Location flowerLocation(Flower f)
        If f is in the list produced by flowerList(), return the location of f. Otherwise, return null. If f is null, return null. Note that null will be returned if the flower is not present on the map or if the flower is present on the map but has not yet been discovered. Note that flowers are equal if and only if their flowerId's are equal. Thus, we could pass you a Flower instance with a null location field. Therefore, returning f.getLocation() is not always guaranteed to work.
        Parameters:
        f - A flower.
        Returns:
        The Location of f if f has been discovered. null otherwise.

      • flowerLocation

        public abstract Location flowerLocation(long flowerId)
        If there exists a flower with the flower id in the list of flowers returned by flowerList(), then return the location of . If there does not exist a flower , then return null.
        Parameters:
        flowerId - A flower id.
        Returns:
        The location of the flower with flower id . null otherwise.

      • getPower

        public Power getPower()
        Return the butterfly's power.
